intro: Isolepis consocialis, commonly known as the clustered spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy environments in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant typically grows in dense clusters, with slender, cylindrical stems that are often slightly hairy. Its inflorescence consists of a single, terminal spike that bears small, inconspicuous flowers. Isolepis consocialis plays an important ecological role by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
